meanings.sent1: Yesterday, I loaned my friend a book.
meanings.sent2: She loaned me her umbrella when it started raining.
meanings.sent3: The library loaned out so many books that they ran out of space!
meanings.sent4: He loaned his expertise to the project, making it a success.
meanings.sent5: The teacher loaned her patience to the struggling student, helping them learn.

meanings.sent1: She loaned her car to me for the weekend.
meanings.sent2: The shop loaned out tools to customers for free.
meanings.sent3: The hotel loaned extra towels to the guests for their pool day.
meanings.sent4: The company loaned laptops to employees during the conference.
meanings.sent5: The neighbor loaned a ladder to help with the home repairs.

meanings.sent1: I loaned a pen from my classmate for the test.
meanings.sent2: She loaned a dress from her sister for the party.
meanings.sent3: He loaned a bike from the rental shop for the weekend.
meanings.sent4: The library loaned a rare book from another institution for the exhibit.
meanings.sent5: They loaned a recipe from a famous chef for the cooking competition.
